snippet: When Brenda Clubine arrived in prison 7 years ago to serve 15 years to life for killing a husband more than twice her size, she was beginning to ask herself questions about the violence she had suffered and in turn had meted out, about the Gordian...
lead_paragraph: When Brenda Clubine arrived in prison 7 years ago to serve 15 years to life for killing a husband more than twice her size, she was beginning to ask herself questions about the violence she had suffered and in turn had meted out, about the Gordian knot that ties the abuser and the abused. "I had two choices," said Ms. Clubine, a tiny, 41-year-old former nurse who said she had endured years of savage beatings by her husband. "I could commit suicide, or I could try to understand what was going on in my life."

headline.main: Abused Women Who Kill Now Seek Way Out of Cells
